description.narrative: I-SEMER: Employment and income activities in disadvantaged governorates of Tunisi: I-SEMER stands for „Initiative Suisse pour l’Emploi et la Micro- et Petite Entreprise Rurale“. The programme targets 4 disadvantaged governorates (Kef, Kasserine, Sidi Bouzid and Medenine) and is made up of 3 complementary components, all of which target young men and women who are mostly unemployed and living in rural areas: (1) Roundtables: decentralized, inclusive coordination and decision-making mechanisms to improve the local business climate and address key constraints; (2) Training and micro-credits (ENDA): 5000 unemployed young men and women have been coached/trained to set-up microenterprises resulting in the creation of 1’500 microenterprises. Existing microenterprises will be helped to formalize and expand their activities resulting in an additional 2’000 jobs created. (3) Small enterprise creation (BFPME): Support 110 (micro-) small enterprises selected through the “Concours Tuniso-Suisse” with start-up loans and technical capacity building; in addition, provide start-up loans for 65 small enterprises with vetted and pending financing applications (short-term intervention components). This should create 1’750 jobs in all. Overall goal: Contribute to economic growth and social peace by creating employment opportunities for young unemployed people in disadvantaged governorates.

organisation.narrative: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation SDC

recipient-region.narrative: rural, disadvantaged governorates (mainly Kef, Kasserine, Sidi Bouzid and Medenine)
